Worrying points: lack of consistent consultation, variation between depts, hours paid â‰  hours worked, training not consistently paid (1/2)
Promising points: pay up overall (linked to nat pay framewk), written contracts(!), notice period, holiday pay, dignity@work policy
STP sounds rushed. Consultation a postcode lottery. Some contracts only partly issued - teaching but nothing of marking etc.
STP steering group (HR & snr mgmt) decides policy, pay, T&Cs, leadership. No UCU or dept rep. User group there to "provide feedback"..

Good Q from @mdieter - what about accounting for technologies that disintegrate or become obsolete? (Or changes applications) #ciminterfaces
At the top of the pyramid are those technologies which have become naturalised: cooking, agriculture #ciminterfaces http://t.co/fS5xc5HOLB
Handwriting is an example further up the pyramid: those which have become 'invisible' as technologies. Also money, clock time #ciminterfaces
Next are 'vital' technologies, those without which life would become hard. Sewerage for example. I'd also suggest glasses. #ciminterfaces
Then we have 'accepted' technologies; those which have become part of everyday life eg smartphone #ciminterfaces
Further up the pyramid of technology from 'envisioned' we have operational (usually prototypes) and applied (more affordable) #ciminterfaces
Minority Report at #ciminterfaces - there is a realm of technology which is only envisioned. See also: time machines. http://t.co/wniE3onS71
From geosphere to biosphere to noosphere #ciminterfaces
